reviews.review_msg: One of the best profs I've had, lectures were engaging and well organized. He really makes an effort to make the class interesting to students. 2 papers and a few summaries required throughout the course. The midterm was fair and the final was a take-home exam.

interesting lectures, attendance is only mandatory to get participation, but content is not all relevant. gives good feedback on writing pieces and just overall a really chill guy. I enjoyed his class

Dai engaged us in discussions but wasn't really open to hearing  opinions others than his own, even if they were well backed up. The course material was fairly narrow. It is a course on Env. ethics and we didn't look at indigenous or eastern thought, which was disappointing.  This class would be better for someone who has not taken ethics before.
